results.name: Substitute ones for all nonzero digits in factorial base representation of n: a(n) = A059590(A275727(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..40319
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: For n=23 whose factorial base representation is "321", when we replace each nonzero digit with 1, we get "111", the factorial base representation of 9, thus a(23) = 9.
program: (define (A276008 n) (let loop ((n n) (s 0) (f 1) (i 2)) (if (zero? n) s (let ((d (modulo n i))) (if (zero? d) (loop (/ n i) s (* i f) (+ 1 i)) (loop (/ (- n d) i) (+ s f) (* i f) (+ 1 i)))))))
from sympy import factorial as f
def a007623(n, p=2): return n if n
y="".join('1' if int(i)>0 else '0' for i in x)[::-1]
return sum([int(y[i])*f(i + 1) for i in range(len(y))])
